page.title: 12CABINET MAKER, LITTLE WALTON
page.content: Andrew Varah Ltd. is one of the{trades not involving farming in the block. In 1975 Mr Varah & his family moved to a very dilapidated (1680) Little Walton farmhouse.Whilst restoring the house he continued his{furniture business}in the barn.Every piece designed is unique & in his personal style, only a photographic record of his furniture being retained.Business comes from re- commendations;50% from{Architects}comm -issioning{furniture}to compliment a building.He enjoys working with exotic woods, buying from idividual estates, farmers & timber merchants.He{employs} 4 young craftsmen direct from college, expecting them to leave after a few years to work independently. In 1986 hopes to complete his seating design to encircle a central altar by{Sir} {Henry Moore}at St. Stephen Walbrook Church, City of London.
